item.title: “A Hitchhiker’s Guide to R for Data Science (2e)”; RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 15 Oct, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the October 2025 meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 15 Sep (6p, AE217) will be “A Hitchhiker’s Guide to ‘R for Data Science (2e)’”. Whether you are new to R or consider yourself a veteran, you’ll gain a new appreciation of the R language and platform through the lens of R4DS! RPIrates is led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Rensselaer IDEA and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. Pizza and salad starts at 5:30p.

item.description: Tues. Oct. 14, 2025 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM - The Office of Graduate Education & Graduate Experience invites all graduate students to a special appreciation dinner. This event offers a platform to connect with Deans and staff in a laid-back setting and cultivate a stronger graduate student community.

item.title: RPI at Work to Host Mechanical Engineering Information Session | Oct. 15
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 15, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join RPI at Work faculty on a 30-minute information session covering RPI’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Learn how professionals can develop their practice in core mechanical disciplines…

item.description: Wednesday, October 15, 2025 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. item.title: RPI now has access to the full IEEE Electronic Library
item.description: The RPI Libraries are pleased to announce that the RPI community now has full access to the IEEE Electronic Library (IEL), which provides full-text IEEE content published since 1988, with select content dating back to 1884, from journals, conferences, transactions, magazines, standards, and more.

item.title: Seasonal HVAC Transition - Cooling to Heating 2025
item.description: The Physical Plant’s HVAC team will begin transitioning campus buildings from cooling to heating starting Tuesday, October 7th with completion expected by Wednesday, October 15th. Please be advised that during the start-up process, it is normal to hear small banging and clanging noises as the piping warms up and we come up to full pressure; additionally, a slight burning odor is common.

item.title: CEE Fall Seminar Series - Dr. Zhibin Chen | Oct. 15
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 15, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - “Planning of Truck Platooning for Road-Network Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem”. Truck platooning, a linking technology of trucks on the highway, has gained enormous attention in recent years due to its benefits in energy and operation cost savings. However, most existing studies on truck platooning limit their focus on particular scenarios that each truck can serve only one customer demand and is thus with a specified origin.

item.title: Robust Admission Via Two-Stage Matching under Ranking Uncertainty | Oct. 15
item.description: Please join ISE for a Colloquium Speaker: Dr. Gustavo Angulo and his seminar on Robust Admission Via Two-Stage Matching under Ranking Uncertainty. Dr. Gustavo Angulo is an associate professor at the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering of Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile. His research interests are in mixed-integer programming and stochastic programming All Faculty and students are welcome to attend!

item.title: Join us for the next talk in the Quantum Vision Lecture Series | Oct. 13
item.description:
Mon., Oct. 13, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM Featuring Elias Towe, Ph.D., Grobstein Professor of Materials Science and Engineering & Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Carnegie Mellon University. The talk will explore innovative strategies for advancing quantum research and discuss opportunities to leverage RPI’s intellectual and infrastructure strengths to enhance our position at the forefront of this rapidly evolving domain. 30 minute presentation, followed by a discussion.
